function_call.name: classify_risks_framework
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Limitations of qualitative approach in wbe monitoring","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of intercommunity comparison in semi-quantitative approach of wbe monitoring","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Limited understanding of intra-and inter-person variability in the magnitude of virus excretion/shedding","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Uncertainty regarding the excretion-route distribution of virus markers, fecal versus urine and unknown importance for different markers","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of knowledge about the half-life persistence of virus markers in wastewater and its impact on sampling methods and measurement accuracy","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inadequate monitoring of sewage networks and treatment plants can lead to delayed detection of contagious diseases","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Difficulty in accurately estimating the population size contributing to a sewage treatment plant can result in inaccurate calculations of the percentage of infected population","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Comparison of infection rates between communities using wbe monitoring data requires careful calibration and standardization procedures","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Insufficient monitoring data for contagious diseases","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Insufficient testing leading to lack of confidence in the public about the risk of covid-19 transmission","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Possibility of repeated resurgence of covid-19 and common seasonal infectious diseases","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Reliance on preprints without peer review for research and decision-making","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of international coordination in wbe research for covid-19 and other infectious diseases","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Use of pcr to test for covid-19 may overestimate the incidence or intensity of existing infections due to rna fragments from virus remnants","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inadequate surveillance systems may result in delayed detection of emerging clusters of infectious diseases","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Infection densities revealed by wbe monitoring may uncover community vulnerabilities related to race, ethnicity, socioeconomic status, occupation, age structure, and climate","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Contrarian views regarding infectivity and spreading of contagious diseases","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Insufficient data on fecal markers for sars-cov-2","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inadequate monitoring of infectious virus in fecal microbiota transplant samples","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Fecal-oral transmission route could prove significant","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Fecal becoming an alternative route for clinical diagnostic testing for covid-19","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Prolonged presence of covid-19 rna in feces after respiratory tract tests negative","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Global cooperation not comprehensive due to government reluctance or lack of resources","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of centralized clearing house for wbe data and knowledge","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Reluctance to publicize wbe data by some governments","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of coordination and standardization in wbe pilot projects targeting covid-19","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of unified worldwide plan for wbe development","category":"Society","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Limited interest and involvement of politicians, military leaders, and government officials in wbe development","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Mention of drug use may pose a risk of substance abuse and addiction, which can contribute to public health issues and disease transmission","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Mention of national coalitions or efforts for covid-19 may indicate areas with active transmission and potential for disease spread","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of standardized testing for intercomparisons of monitoring data","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Geographically fragmented data collection and reporting system","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Rapid growth in wbe for monitoring infectious disease","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Wbe not used to monitor for viable, infectious virions","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Erroneous belief in the presence of \"live\" virus in sewage","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Intense interest in the potential release of virus into surface waters","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Limited national reception of wbe in the u.s. for covid-19 tracking","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of interest from state and federal governments in the u.s.","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Delay in u.s. federal agencies’ interest in wbe for covid-19 tracking","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Potential spread of contagious diseases due to reduced social distancing measures and increased urban activity","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Challenges in adapting existing urban infrastructure to meet the demands of medical activities such as mass vaccination, testing, and treatment","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Debate on the compatibility of compact city model with the concept of pandemic-proof cities","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Widespread experience of covid-19 as a shock to the system","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Unprecedented experience posing grave new challenges for cities, nations, and the world","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Reemergence of diseases through sudden outbreaks","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Environmental factors such as rainfall, temperature, and soil types creating conditions for microbe proliferation","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Socio-economic, demographic, and cultural factors contributing to the emergence and spread of disease","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Mobility patterns and trade routes facilitating the spread of infectious diseases","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Deadly disease outbreak in field hospitals and spread along railway and shipping routes","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Historical reliance on divine explanations and miasma theory for disease outbreaks","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"}]}
